quiz_questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
Which HTML element is used for creating an unordered list?
Which HTML tag is used to add an image to a webpage?
Which HTML element represents the top-level container of a webpage?
Which HTML tag is used to define a line break?
Which HTML element is used to emphasize text without any semantic importance?
Which HTML tag is used to define a table row?
Which attribute is used to provide an alternate text for images in HTML?
Which HTML element is used to define the structure of an HTML document?
In HTML, which tag is used to create an ordered list?
Which HTML attribute is used to specify the URL of the linked resource?
Which HTML tag is used to define a hyperlink?
What is the purpose of the HTML <head> element?
options: To display the main content of the webpage
To define the structure of the webpage
To provide metadata about the webpage
To format the text on the webpage
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To provide metadata about the webpage

quiz_questions.question: Which HTML element is used to create a clickable button?
What does CSS stand for?
Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
How can you include an external CSS file in an HTML document?
Which CSS property is used to add spacing between elements?
What is the correct CSS syntax for selecting an element with the class 'highlight'?
Which CSS property is used to change the background color of an element?
What is the purpose of the CSS 'float' property?
options: To make text float on water
To align text to the left or right of its container
To control the font size of text
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To align text to the left or right of its container

quiz_questions.question: Which CSS property is used to control the space between the content and border of an element?
What is the purpose of the CSS 'position' property?
options: To set the font style of an element
To specify the position of an element in the layout
To change the color of an element
To add spacing around an element
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To specify the position of an element in the layout

quiz_questions.question: Which CSS unit is relative to the font size of the element?
Which CSS property is used to control the order of flexible items in a flex container?
In CSS, which value is used with the 'position' property to position an element relative to its normal position?
Which CSS property is used to create rounded corners on an element?
What is the CSS property used to control the space between lines of text?
Which CSS property is used to control the visibility of an element?
What does JavaScript do?
options: Defines the structure of the web page
Adds interactivity to the web page
Creates animations on the web page
quiz_questions.correct_answer: Adds interactivity to the web page

quiz_questions.question: Which keyword is used to declare a variable in JavaScript?
What symbol is used for single-line comments in JavaScript?
Which built-in function can be used to display a dialog box with a message?
Which operator is used to concatenate strings in JavaScript?
What is the result of `typeof null` in JavaScript?
Which method is used to add an element to the end of an array?
What does the '===' operator do in JavaScript?
options: Assigns a value to a variable
Compares two values for equality without type conversion
Checks if a variable is defined
quiz_questions.correct_answer: Compares two values for equality without type conversion

quiz_questions.question: Which JavaScript keyword is used to declare a function?
What is the purpose of the 'return' statement in a JavaScript function?
options: To stop the execution of the function
To return a value from the function
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To return a value from the function

quiz_questions.question: Which loop is used to iterate over the properties of an object?
What is the purpose of the 'addEventListener' method in JavaScript?
options: To add a new HTML element to the page
To attach an event handler function to an HTML element
To change the style of an HTML element
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To attach an event handler function to an HTML element

quiz_questions.question: Which global JavaScript function is used to convert a string to an integer?
What is the purpose of the 'setTimeout' function in JavaScript?
options: To add a delay before executing a function
To stop the execution of a function
To repeat a function at intervals
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To add a delay before executing a function

quiz_questions.question: Which JavaScript method is used to remove the last element from an array?
What is React.js?
Which concept in React is responsible for rendering components based on their state?
In React, which component lifecycle method is called after a component has been rendered to the DOM?
What is JSX in React?
options: A data format used for API responses
JavaScript XML, a syntax extension for JavaScript
quiz_questions.correct_answer: JavaScript XML, a syntax extension for JavaScript

quiz_questions.question: What is the purpose of props in React?
options: To define the structure of a component
To pass data from parent to child components
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To pass data from parent to child components

quiz_questions.question: Which method is used to change the state of a React component?
What is the purpose of the 'render' method in a React component?
options: To render the component's HTML representation
To create a new component instance
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To render the component's HTML representation

quiz_questions.question: In React, what is the purpose of the 'key' prop when rendering a list of elements?
options: To define the initial state of the component
To specify the element's position in the list
To uniquely identify each element in the list
To apply styles to the element
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To uniquely identify each element in the list

quiz_questions.question: What is the recommended way to update the state in React based on the previous state?
options: Using the prevState parameter in setState()
quiz_questions.correct_answer: Using the prevState parameter in setState()

quiz_questions.question: What is the purpose of React Router?
options: To manage the state of React components
To handle HTTP requests in React
To add styling to React components
To handle routing and navigation in React applications
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To handle routing and navigation in React applications

quiz_questions.question: What is Next.js?
options: A JavaScript framework for building web applications
quiz_questions.correct_answer: A JavaScript framework for building web applications

quiz_questions.question: What is Server-Side Rendering (SSR) in Next.js?
options: Rendering a web page on the client side
Rendering a web page on the server side and sending the HTML to the client
Rendering a web page using a separate rendering server
Rendering a web page using a dedicated rendering framework
quiz_questions.correct_answer: Rendering a web page on the server side and sending the HTML to the client

quiz_questions.question: How do you create a new Next.js project?
Which file is used to define server-side routing in Next.js?
What is the purpose of the 'getStaticProps' function in Next.js?
options: To define styles for a component
To fetch data at build time and pass it to a page component
To manage state in a component
quiz_questions.correct_answer: To fetch data at build time and pass it to a page component
